column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.RoleAnnotation|roles
#Text=Ms.
#Text=Gallardo Hernandez (El Salvador) (spoke in Spanish): Allow me to express my Government's\r
#Text=satisfaction about the fact that the Security Council has\r
#Text=continued to address this important issue.
#Text=I would also\r
#Text=like to thank you, Mr.
#Text=President, for your initiative to\r
#Text=convene this open debate, on the fourth anniversary of\r
#Text=the adoption of resolution 1325 (2004), on the subject\r
#Text=of women and peace and security.
#Text=This is an\r
#Text=exceedingly important subject, as it leads us to take up\r
#Text=critical areas of the Beijing Platform for Action dealing\r
#Text=with women and armed conflict.
#Text=It also leads us to\r
#Text=address efforts aimed at the maintenance of\r
#Text=international peace and security, which is the primary\r
#Text=role of the Council.
#Text=The Government of El Salvador would like to\r
#Text=reiterate its concern about the fact that civilians - and\r
#Text=especially women, children and older persons -\r
#Text=continue to suffer from the devastating consequences\r
#Text=of armed conflict, including as refugees and internally\r
#Text=displaced persons.
#Text=As we all know, that has a grave\r
#Text=impact on lasting peace and reconciliation.
#Text=The experience of the people of El Salvador with\r
#Text=armed conflict during more than a decade enables us\r
#Text=today to be able to pass on some lessons learned\r
#Text=associated with the subject under discussion.
#Text=Among\r
#Text=those lessons, we wish to point out that women are a\r
#Text=basic pillar in maintaining family cohesion, struggling\r
#Text=for daily existence, keeping a clear focus on their\r
#Text=children's priority needs, passing on values and life\r
#Text=experiences and becoming the person who establishes\r
#Text=spaces for dialogue and agreement, thereby making her\r
#Text=the one who can most accurately identify possible\r
#Text=areas of intolerance.
#Text=The Government of El Salvador would like to\r
#Text=emphasize that it is important and necessary for women\r
#Text=to participate comprehensively and on an equal footing\r
#Text=in all initiatives designed to maintain and promote\r
#Text=peace and security, as well as in United Nations\r
#Text=peacekeeping and peace-building efforts.
#Text=It is therefore\r
#Text=essential that we promote and strengthen women's\r
#Text=participation in the decision-making processes\r
#Text=associated with the prevention and resolution of\r
#Text=conflict.
#Text=Similarly, we believe it essential for women to\r
#Text=have access to information channels in order that they\r
#Text=may be able to identify potential sources of violence,\r
#Text=open up new spaces for dialogue among society and\r
#Text=instil the values of tolerance and peace, which are\r
#Text=essential if peace is to last.
#Text=My delegation would like to point out that, for\r
#Text=peace to be genuine, women must be able to benefit\r
#Text=from peace dividends.
#Text=In our opinion, this is one of the\r
#Text=most important lessons we have learned, because\r
#Text=women are capable of looking beyond their individual\r
#Text=interests to focus on priorities that strengthen the\r
#Text=family and its surroundings, very often at the expense\r
#Text=of their own needs.
#Text=The Government of El Salvador supports the\r
#Text=initiatives designed to incorporate a gender perspective\r
#Text=in peacekeeping operations.
#Text=For this reason, we\r
#Text=welcome the decision of the Security Council, set out\r
#Text=in resolution 1325 (2000), to give all peacekeeping\r
#Text=personnel specialized training in the area of protection,\r
#Text=special needs and the human rights of women, children\r
#Text=and the elderly in conflict situations.
#Text=In this regard, we urge the Security Council to\r
#Text=draw on the accumulated experience and specialized\r
#Text=expertise in gender issues of the relevant institutions of\r
#Text=the United Nations.
#Text=In particular, we would like to\r
#Text=refer here to the United Nations International Research\r
#Text=and Training Institute for the Advancement of Women,\r
#Text=as well as the successful experiences of each and every\r
#Text=Member State.
#Text=At the same time, we urge the Secretary-General\r
#Text=to continue his efforts to broaden the role and\r
#Text=contributions of women to United Nations operations,\r
#Text=both on the ground and at Headquarters.
#Text=This would\r
#Text=apply in particular to military observers, civilian police\r
#Text=and personnel working on the promotion and protection\r
#Text=of human rights and humanitarian tasks.
#Text=In conclusion, allow me once again to state that\r
#Text=the Government of El Salvador is ready to continue\r
#Text=supporting all the initiatives and measures taken by the\r
#Text=Security Council to promote a gender perspective and\r
#Text=the advancement of women.
#Text=It is also willing to\r
#Text=contribute to actions designed to protect and promote\r
#Text=the rights of women in conflict situations, giving them\r
#Text=scope to participate in the long-term process of\r
#Text=reconciliation - the only thing that can guarantee a\r
#Text=new form of coexistence within countries.
